snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday's selection includes the possible economic effects of eliminating Facebook friends, Zynga's quest to find new audiences for its ga...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday's selection includes the possible economic effects of eliminating Facebook friends, Zynga's quest to find new audiences for its games by buying Draw Something, and a surge in new mobile devices in China.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Flying Servers and Estimating YouTube's Worth

snippet: Some eye-catching and imaginative book apps for young-adult readers.
abstract: Some eye-catching and imaginative book apps for young-adult readers.

headline.main: App Smart Extra: Book Apps for Young Adults

snippet: Apps and games may look great on the new iPad’s high-resolution “retina” display, but it’s uncertain whether Web sites will get the same treatment.
abstract: Apps and games may look great on the new iPad’s high-resolution “retina” display, but it’s uncertain whether Web sites will get the same treatment.

headline.main: Is the New iPad Screen Too Good for the Web?
headline.print_headline: A Screen Too Good For Web Display?

snippet: Western Digital has introduced My Book Live, an external hard drive that creates a personal cloud for shared storage on a home network.
abstract: Western Digital has introduced My Book Live, an external hard drive that creates a personal cloud for shared storage on a home network.

headline.print_headline: A Cloud of One’s Own For Storage and Backup, But Not Without Pain

snippet: Workers and students, enticed by the start of spring, took their laptops and ideas outside so they could soak in the balmy weather.
abstract: Busy professionals and college students across New York City take advantage of a balmy first day of spring to hold meetings and study sessions outdoors.

headline.main: In Sun’s Glow, It’s Still Business, but Not as Usual
headline.print_headline: In Sun’s Glow, It’s Still Business, but Not as Usual

snippet: With the Barclays Center arena set to open in September, property owners in the area remain uncertain about the rest of the Atlantic Yards project in Brooklyn.
abstract: Barclays Center arena is set to open later this year, but property owners in the area remain uncertain about the rest of the Atlantic Yards project in Brooklyn; landlords are being cautious about long-term leases as they wait with what can be described as optimistic uncertainty about what the project will do for real estate prices, and how the neighborhood will be shaped.

headline.main: In Barclays Center’s Shadow, Awaiting What’s Next
headline.print_headline: In Barclays Center’s Shadow, Awaiting What’s Next

snippet: Rothmans, long a purveyor of midline suits, has undertaken a rebranding, trying to update its product mix, making it younger and more aspirational.
abstract: Jon Caramanica reviews Union Square location of mid-line menswear store Rothmans, featuring updated collections of suits and casual-wear geared to younger and more aspirational shoppers.

snippet: Hewlett-Packard will merge its personal computer and printing divisions in an effort to cut costs, improve designs and gain efficiency, the company announced.
abstract: Hewlett-Packard announces that it will merge its personal computer and printing divisions in an effort to cut costs, improve designs and gain efficiency; consolidation is the first major strategic move since Meg Whitman became chief executive in 2011.

headline.print_headline: H.P. Is Said to Be Poised To Merge Business Units

snippet: Stock market indexes faltered after reports out of China raised concerns about its growth and amid worries over the high price of oil.
abstract: Stocks market indexes decline, ending a three-day advance for the Standard & Poor's 500-stock index, as commodities fell on concerns about a Chinese economic showdown.

headline.main: Shares Fall on Concerns of a Slowdown in China
headline.print_headline: Shares Fall on Concerns Of a Slowdown in China

snippet: Q.     How do I remove apps from my iPad or iPhone and keep them off?
abstract: Personal Tech Q&A on permanently removing apps from an iPad or iPhone. (M)4
